list_definition.definition: something that preserves, especially that prevents food etc from going bad

list_ex_of_english: The question of preservatives in other articles, notably in milk, had been mentioned.
With regard to preservatives and synthetic additives, the human body has excellent mechanisms for disposing of substances for which it can find no use.
I know that it has been suggested that the condition might have been caused by the treatment of his house with wood preservatives.
They must either prohibit these chemicals whether under the name of preservatives or substitutes, or else admit them freely without any restriction whatever.
We must see to it that none of these processes or preservatives is such as is likely to cause illness.
I express no view here on the safety or otherwise of food additives, colourings and preservatives.
The toxicity can come from the food we eat, nine-tenths of which contains colouring, flavouring, preservatives and other additives.
We are talking here about insecticides, disinfectants, preservatives and products used to protect materials, to mention but a few.
